title: Dodo Marmarosa / Bebop piano / 1946-7 / Lucky Thompson
description:
A somewhat obscure but nonetheless important bebop practitioner on piano.

Michael Marmarosa aka "Dodo" (1925-2002) 

  



"The bebop era produced a crop of brilliant pianists whose careers were all

tainted by personal misfortune or tragedy, cutting their careers short.

BUD POWELL's life illustrates this fate in it's starkest form, but similar

scenarios could be written about JOE ALBANY, AL HAIG, GEORGE WALLINGTON,

ELMO HOPE, RONNIE BALL and DODO MARMAROSA, the subject of this compilation.


Dodo Marmarosa's era was the 1940's, during which he set the jazz world alight

with his brilliant sound and highly original bebop influenced lines on many

recordings both as a sideman and as a leader in his own right..........."

                  Joop Visser    (from booklet)




Lucky Thompson adds excellent tenor sax on 10 or so of these 28 tracks.
